programme.title: Phantom Ranger
programme.desc: A federal investigator (Tim McCoy) poses as an outlaw to catch a gang of counterfeiters which has kidnapped a government engraver.

programme.title: Fugitive of the Plains
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Buster Crabbe) stages a shootout with outlaws who have transformed an innocent young lady into a wanted desperado.

programme.title: Gunsmoke Ranch
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers (Bob Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune) stop a land swindler out to profit from a flood.

programme.title: 'Neath Canadian Skies
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) tracks mine robbers in 1890s Canada.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Hooded vigilantes are involved in a boundary dispute.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: A gold watch is the only clue to a string of murders.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Uncle Joe decides to go into the cologne business.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Betty Jo becomes the first female contestant in the horseshoe tournament.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: After being wrongfully jailed on a murder charge, Cisco and Pancho escape to capture the real murderer.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco is challenged by a man who seeks revenge after being jailed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt enlists the aid of Dakota chiefs to bring in Crazy Horse.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The man behind a string of stagecoach robberies has remained out of reach of company detectives Matt and Frankie, but reinforcements from the city help to crack the case.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Storts and Hurley hold a doll hostage that brings good luck to a Mexican village.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A couple of con men attempt to lure Letty into their scheme and get her to go to San Francisco.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Outlaw Vic Carver (Robert B. Williams) seeks revenge against Sheriff MacTavish (Kenneth MacDonald) for sending him to jail.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) races to save her retired mentor (Stanley Andrews) from a suicide mission with a merciless young gunman. With Ric Vallin.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Needed winter supplies are being stolen before they can reach the village; Tim, a simple-minded man, is made to believe he killed someone and when he flees he becomes an easy scapegoat.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Carpenter heads into the wilderness to establish a new settlement; Hawkeye and Chingachgook try to prevent disaster.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a neighbor agrees to sell his property, the Cartwrights fear the loss of water rights for their cattle.

programme.title: Days of Jesse James
programme.desc: A singing cowboy (Roy Rogers) clears the outlaw (Donald Barry) and his gang of a bank robbery done by bankers.

programme.title: Frontier Justice
programme.desc: A practical joker (Hoot Gibson) rescues his cattleman father from shady sheepmen.

programme.title: Hands Across the Border
programme.desc: A singing cowboy (Roy Rogers) helps a slain rancher's daughter (Ruth Terry) breed horses for the Army.

programme.title: Colorado
programme.desc: Lieutenant Jerry Burke (Roy Rogers) is sent to Colorado to track down a troublesome gang. When he finally catches them, he finds out his traitorous brother commands them.

programme.title: Hurricane Horseman
programme.desc: A gunsmith (Lane Chandler) offers to fix outlaws' guns if they release their hostage to him.

programme.title: The Way of the West
programme.desc: Cattlemen find themselves at odds with sheep ranchers in the Old West.

programme.title: Hell Town
programme.desc: A rancher (John Mack Brown) makes his cousin (John Wayne) trail boss on a cattle drive headed for trouble.

programme.title: Range War
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and sidekick Lucky (Russell Hayden) help a railroad man (Matt Moore) thwart a land baron.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: A special agent (Randolph Scott) poses as a train robber to infiltrate Frank Reno's (Forrest Tucker) outlaw gang.

programme.title: Valley of Vengeance
programme.desc: Billy Carson (Buster Crabbe) and his childhood buddy (Al "Fuzzy" St. John) avenge their slain families.

programme.title: The Diamond Trail
programme.desc: A New York reporter (Rex Bell) follows a gang of gem smugglers west.

programme.title: Fighting Fury
programme.desc: A boy raised by his servant vows to take revenge on the ranchers who killed his parents.
